intro: Hieracium subcaesium subsp. flocciceps, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, typical of the daisy family. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in meadows and grassy areas. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological and horticultural contexts.
